The Elder Sumaṅgala’s Birth Story
“Desiring to give an offering,
having prepared the food,🔽while standing in the spacious hall,
honouring the brahmins,🔽I saw the Sambuddha,🔽Piyadassin of great fame,
the trainer of the whole world,
the self-dependent, the foremost person.
The Lord, resplendent,
was preceded by his disciples;
shining like the sun,
he was proceeding along the street.
Raising my joined palms,🔽I delighted in my own mind;
with my mind alone I invited him,
‘May the Great Sage come!’
Understanding my thought,
the Teacher, unsurpassed in the world,
together with a thousand of his disciples,

the six super-knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus has it been told by the Elder Sumangala.
